Process and safety information and operating procedures are updated when a change occurs with the process chemicals, technology, equipment, or operational procedures.  



Another element of 3M Elyria's accidental release prevention program is the operator checklist that verifies that operating procedures for the handling and transfer of carbon disulfide are conducted safely. To ensure that the operating procedures are correctly implemented all employees are on a three-year refresher-training schedule.  In addition to the refresher training, 3M Elyria trains operators in any new or updated procedures prior to startup of a process after modification.  Furthermore, personnel are trained in carbon disulfide emergency response procedures and use of appropriate protective equipment.  



Additionally, the carbon disulfide system equipment is inspected and tested by maintenance personnel according to the schedule the 3M Elyria has established as good engineering practice.   



In addition to the above listed components of an effective prevention program, 3M Elyria's prevention program includes procedures for incident investigations. 



To establish that 3M Elyria is successfully implementing all the aspects of the prevention program detailed above and that the covered process is in compliance with RMP regulations, an internal audit is conducted every three years.  



FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY:



A five-year accident release report has not been prepared since there have been no reportable accidents in the past five years.   



EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM:



3M Elyria has prepared an Emergency Response Plan for the Facility.  This plan is periodically reviewed and employees are trained in the proper execution and implementation of the prescribed procedures.  3M Elyria employees are trained to respond to incidental releas

es.  Furthermore, 3M Elyria is included in the Lorain County Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC) emergency response plan and procedures are in place to notify emergency responders when there is an emergency at the  facility.  



PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY:



3M Elyria will incorporate or address recommendations resulting from the hazard review, offsite consequences, incident investigations (if any), and program audits to further improve the safety of the carbon disulfide system.
